item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, February 22, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Discover the IndieWeb, one blog post at a time (67 points | 17 comments)
2. FFmpeg School of Assembly Language (7 points | discuss)
3. Show HN: I Built a Visual Workflow Automation Platform – FlowRipple (51 points | 36 comments)

5. Apple pulls data protection tool after UK government security row (1540 points | 954 comments)
6. Americans Are Heading for the Exits (13 points | 1 comment)
7. These years in Common Lisp: 2023-2024 in review (101 points | 12 comments)
8. When AI Thinks It Will Lose, It Sometimes Cheats, Study Finds (38 points | 34 comments)
9. Why Barcelona Bought the Building That Symbolizes Its Housing Crisis (70 points | 102 comments)
10. French nuclear plant consumes more power than it generates in first two months (13 points | 2 comments)

12. Florida insurers steered money to investors while claiming losses, study says (85 points | 47 comments)
13. Concurrency bugs in Lucene: How to fix optimistic concurrency failures (19 points | 3 comments)
14. Richard Feynman's blackboard at the time of his death (1988) (432 points | 213 comments)
15. Augurs demo (145 points | 7 comments)

20. Do you want to be doing this when you're 50? (2012) (109 points | 108 comments)
21. Accessing the Qualcomm Modem over USB on the RAK5010 (8 points | discuss)
22. Johnny.Decimal – A system to organise your life (487 points | 249 comments)
23. Money lessons without money: The financial literacy fallacy (173 points | 162 comments)
24. How people get rich now (2021) (17 points | 12 comments)
25. Strategic Wealth Accumulation Under Transformative AI Expectations (70 points | 95 comments)
26. PEP 486 – Make the Python Launcher aware of virtual environments (2015) (8 points | 2 comments)
27. Twitch limiting uploads to 100 hours, deleting the rest starting April 19th (92 points | 84 comments)
28. A vending machine, on the internet (157 points | 66 comments)
29. Surface-Stable Fractal Dither on Playdate (118 points | 20 comments)
30. Reality has a surprising amount of detail (2017) (332 points | 173 comments)
